messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1034
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, I am USing now but only with the youngest one at age 10. My oldest is almost 18 and lives with her dad in Medford, Oregon. She ll be graduating from hs
messages.messageBody:
Yes, I am USing now but only with the youngest one at age 10. My oldest
is almost 18 and lives with her dad in Medford, Oregon. She'll be
graduating from hs this year. The schools use phonics to get them to
start reading...bleech! Phonics makes it harder than it should be.
Jessica


On Fri, 9 Mar 2001 16:24:04 EST RValvo7626@... writes:
> In a message dated 3/9/01 10:07:41 AM Mountain Standard Time,
> Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
> << Yes...learning to write, print and spell can sometimes come
> before
> reading. My oldest taught herself how to spell her name, write her
> address and answer the phone in a professional manner at age 3 (I
> am
> hearing impaired) and was reading simple books before going to
> kindergarden. I had no choice...my ex-husband said at that time
> that
> Rebekah was not going to be homeschooled and that as a deaf person
> I was
> incapable of homeschooling. I wish now that I had had more backbone
> at
> that time to tell him to take a flying leap into the lake!
> Jessica
> >>
> At least you are USing now right? Good for you.
>
> Is it the other way around in school though? I cannot remember.
> I can't
> remember doing phonics either but I do them naturally myself. All I
> remember
> is matching dog to D w/ a line and such. We are doing both when she
> asks.
>
> NICKI~
>

Jessica Edwards aka
Vaughnde Edwards
Stampin' Bookworm

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1034
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/9/01 10:07:41 AM Mountain Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/9/01 10:07:41 AM Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Yes...learning to write, print and spell can sometimes come before
reading. My oldest taught herself how to spell her name, write her
address and answer the phone in a professional manner at age 3 (I am
hearing impaired) and was reading simple books before going to
kindergarden. I had no choice...my ex-husband said at that time that
Rebekah was not going to be homeschooled and that as a deaf person I was
incapable of homeschooling. I wish now that I had had more backbone at
that time to tell him to take a flying leap into the lake!
Jessica
>>
At least you are USing now right? Good for you.

Is it the other way around in school though? I cannot remember. I can't
remember doing phonics either but I do them naturally myself. All I remember
is matching dog to D w/ a line and such. We are doing both when she asks.

NICKI~
